tweets.text: On #WorldWildlifeDay, I salute all those working towards wildlife protection. Be it lions, tigers and leopards, India is seeing a steady rise in the population of various animals. We should do everything possible to ensure protection of our forests and safe habitats for animals.

‚Äú They say roar of Royal Bengal Tiger travel up to about two Kilometres. Hope, on this #WorldWildlifeDay this roar travel far and wide so as to put stop üõë to extinction of wildlife taking place at fast speed in last 50 years.‚Äù @WWF @moefcc #sustainability https://t.co/ddyN7AQ9Mq

My first public meeting tonight, re: Welsh Harp SSSI neglect.
Astounded at the doublespeak & circumlocution. 
Appalled at how much money is wasted. 
Angered at the lack of accountability by organisations in charge incl. @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency 
Citizens must act and monitor. https://t.co/btZLt2rlPp

tweets.text: At the Welsh Harp Joint Consultative Committee tonight: After a detailed, well-researched report by @ben_watt we asked whether all stakeholders would commit to responding to each point specifically with clear actions. Chairman Cllr John Hart told us the committee has no power.

@GarethSimkins @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd I thought @EnvAgency made a big deal a couple of years ago about charging landfill tax on illegal dumps but they seem to have forgotten about that as well in a preference to collaborate with perps. Another demonstration of their weakness #saxonpit
@WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd Hang on - under the 2014 environmental sentencing guidelines, fines ARE based on turnover (and other factors, of course).

@Sara_Conway3 @BarnetCouncil I'll get our local team to make contact with you. The volunteers are certainly helping, but you might know #WelshHarp is owned by the @CRTSouthEast. Any other landowner is responsible for maintaining the river area, such as banks and vegetation to control flood-risk. Peter

tweets.text:
Did you see @Yvette_AustinTV interview our Environment Manager Alan Cansdale on BBC South East today? Alan was talking about our annual river maintenance on #RiverMedway. 
Can you believe the amount of debris we collected? üõí üö≤
Catch piece again on BBC South East at 6.30 tonight https://t.co/T3rf7p2Q5M

Thanks to a successful #fishery improvement prog bid to @EnvAgencyYNE with @WildTroutTrust + grant from @SandTCUKYorks, we fenced top of Hubberholme to protect both banks. Now, planting trees for shade & cover. Angler access improved. Roll on trout season https://t.co/QaUaVP33yk

We are responding to a pollution incident at Cardinham Water, Bodmin following the theft of diesel oil from a distribution depot. Absorbent pads and booms have been deployed in the river to reduce any environmental impact. The watercourse is a tributary of the River Fowey. https://t.co/LyDV8vYubC

urls.title: Get involved in the National Waste Crime Survey 2021
